overview_of_class: This course examines theories and research dealing with communication in formal organizations and institutions. Various models of organizational communication are introduced, as well as historical and current research in the field. Students learn to analyze and integrate theory and research and apply what they learn to current organizations. This course combines classroom lecture and discussion with an online component.
name: Theories of Organizational Communication
title: SCS COMM_ST 360-CN-19 Theories of Organizational Communication

Various models of organizational communication are introduced, as well as historical and current research in the field. descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: For the lecture and discussion components, this course is paired with a morning session of LOB/STAT 202-CN taught by Jerry Lassa, and the class meets on alternate Saturdays: 4/2, 4/16, 4/30, 5/14, 6/4. For the online component, students must have ready access to the Internet. Enrollment in this course is limited to BLP year one students only. First class attendance is mandatory.
